ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 3 hours, more for weeks when written assignments were due.
5-12 hrs
3-4 hrs per week

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: The assignments for this course consisted of critiquing current literature concerning vaccines. Student are taught how to critically read scientific articles.
This course covered so many different aspects of vaccine development and design. It was very structured and concepts followed a logical progression.
I loved the class and learned so much.
-Sometimes I did not have enough background to understand the molecular mechanisms that we addressed in class. Perhaps a little more background at the beginning of class would have been helpful.
very informative, though i wish i could have taken more advantage of it!
Best class I've had in EPH

Great course with great speakers. Sometimes there was a significant spread in the material presented. Some speakers were physicians that performed solely clinical work while others were researchers that aimed to develop novel vaccine strategies.Weaknesses: all the material posted on the class website was rather disorganized and difficult to navigate.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Diane McMahon-Pratt  Dr. Pratt is very knowledgeable in her field and provided the students with much insight during the course. She was very receptive to the students concerns and was an excellent instructor.

Instructor: Diane McMahon-Pratt  Diane was very knowledgeable on the topic of vaccines and immunology, and she was able to thoroughly explain difficult biological mechanisms to the class. She was approachable and friendly with students.

Instructor: Diane McMahon-Pratt  She is so amazingly smart and yet completely down to earth. I enjoyed her ability to ask questions along with the rest of the class. It made me more comfortable asking questions.
Instructor: Diane McMahon-Pratt  Dr. McMahon-Pratt is an excellent professor. I learned so much from her and her breadth of knowledge. She also was concerned about patients.
Instructor: Diane McMahon-Pratt  -she was quite clear in what she expected of students. She did not lecture very often, but when she did she was quite good. I wish she had lectured more in fact.
Instructor: Diane McMahon-Pratt  diane has always been very encouraging and helpful in helping understand the concepts presented by speakers.
Instructor: Diane McMahon-Pratt  Best prof that I have had.
Instructor: Diane McMahon-Pratt  Dr. McMahon-Pratt provided great resources to help the students understand the material and was always available for help.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: The TA provided the students with office hours during the course to help us understand some of the more difficult topics concerning vaccines.

Allison did a great job helping out with the class. She came to every lecture, and graded our response papers promptly. She was always kind enough to include helpful comments and advice on the papers - in terms of clarifying points from the articles and suggesting improvements for the next paper.
The TA didn't do anything in this course. I don't really understand why she was there.
She was not involved in the class.
-The TA did not really teach, so I have no comment. She was very nice.
allison is always fun and helpful.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would highly recommend this course to anyone who is interested in learning more about vaccines.
I have already recommended this course to my fellow students. It was a great experience, and I learned a lot over this semester.
I would highly suggest the course. I learned so much and enjoyed the presentations.

-This is a great class, but it is very heavy on the molecular aspects of vaccinology. It requires a significant amount of time to really understand what is going on the readings, and you have to write extensive critiques of papers every other week. So be prepared!
an overview of current research in vaccinology with good information on biology and immunology of mechanisms
Excellent course for anyone with a strong interest in vaccine research and microbial disease. I would recommend this course to other EMD students.
